data.title: Vegi Vegi Good
data.text: We had the buffet...EVERY item in the buffet table was wonderfully prepared and well presented.  Gluten free options and healthy choices abound.  From Pad Thai, to Brown Fried Rice, Tom Yum Soup, Black Rice/Bean with Coconut Milk, Vegetable Curry, Steamed Vegetables, to Spinach Salad ... you can't go wrong with any or all of these to choose from.

data.title: A Good Thai and Vegan Place
data.text: The location of the restaurant in Main Street is central . Araya are known for their Thai Cuisine and this restaurant  serves Great food. We went for Dinner during Week End and so the place was crowded and we have to wait. We had vegetable Satai  and it was delicious . As main Course we tried Vegetable Fried Rice and Noodles. The Food is tasty and we have no hesitation in recommending this  Restaurant for Thai Food Lovers.

data.title: Veg delight
data.text:
Love their new location on Main St.  Light and airy, great corner spot.
Food was fantastic, love not having to ask about ingredients.  I know it is not only vegetarian but vegan.  Super tastey.

data.title: Amazing Food
data.text: It's a very small Vegan restaurant in Old Bellevue with a perfect ambiance and great food.  Please prepare to wait at least 20 minutes on the weekend.

data.title: Vegetarian Thai Food Buffet; good choices and tasty
data.text: This restaurant has recently moved and reopened a couple of blocks away on Main Street in Old Bellevue.  Nice ambiance and clean.  Good service with water and drink requests taken quickly and attractive waitresses.  The vegetarian buffet is set up on the west side wall of the restaurant and is not very spacious and can get congested and crowded when the restaurant is full, but waits are not too long although there can be a bit of confusion as to what end to start from with people meeting going in opposite directions in the middle.  Salads and fruit are very good; but disappointed that the buffet did not have som tam (green papaya salad).  The egg rolls are very good as is the brown rice and pad thai.  Lots of veggies - in curry and stir fried,  The Tom Kha soup was very good although mine was a but cool.  Actually, they need to check the temperature of all the dishes more frequently as many of the dishes were luke warm to cool.  A surprising addition was a version of kim chee which while not Thai dish, was a nice complement to the other dishes.  All in all, a good experience and I would come back again, but I would give a slight nod to the lunch buffet at Suko Thai on Bel-Red Road; it  is just a tad better.

data.title: So good
data.text: Loved it...and we had the Buffett at lunch.  I can't even imagine how great dinner might be.  Rice was fantastic, as were the spring rolls and curry.  So good.  Will absolutely be back.  Service was great as well.

data.title: Vegetarian Thai food at it's best!
data.text: I recently asked my wife, who is Laotian, if there were any vegetarian Laotian restaurants, since Lao even eat "meat" salads, called Larb. Some are even served in a raw tartare fashion. We had the Tofu Larb, Vegan Chicken & Avocado Curry (which was amazing), and we tried out their buffet. My wife, non-vegetarian, loved it, and I loved it, too. We are so glad that we found this place as the food was exquisite.Araya’s Place

data.title: A Vegetarian/vegan dream
data.text: It's nice when you're a vegetarian/vegan, and you can order anything on the menu without having to analyze it. That's Araya's Place. You can consider the style to be general Asian, because the menu is so extensive. I would say even if you're not "vegetarian" in particular, the quality and uniqueness of the food will impress you. They give you plenty of food so that one dish is likely enough for two people, so expect leftovers. The decor is nice and the service is better than most Asian restaurants. We can't wait to eat here again.

data.title: Dinner is Superb
data.text: This place serves very goof food and has a large selection of items to choose from the menu.  The service and abidance is very good.  A very nice place to spend an evening outing with the family.  The food is served with your choice of the spice level.

data.title: Best Asian vegetarian ever!
data.text:
I do not understand some of the "terrible" reviews, but possibly they were pertaining to the buffet. My boyfriend and I thought that this was some of the most incredible vegetarian food that we have had! We went for the dinner and everything was seasoned to perfection. I had the pumpkin curry that included seitan, crispy tofu, and soft tofu which is rare to ever find in one dish. They use a star system to allow the customer to control the level of spice. I had a number 4 and it was perfect! The sauce was delicately seasoned and the pumpkin in the dish was seasoned to perfection. The consistency of all of the tofu/seitan was not gummy in the slightest as some meat substitutes often are when you eat out. The plates are very large, so you should prepare to have leftovers. 

The servers were attentive and very nice. The atmosphere was also enjoyable as it was before the dinner rush and it allowed for us to enjoy the decor which was quite inviting. 

For dessert my boyfriend had the black rice pudding with coconut milk. He thought that it was excellent, but I didn't care for the consistency. I could tell however that if one liked things that are like a harder, chewier white rice pudding, then they would have enjoyed this dish. I could tell that care was taken to prepare this dish. 

It was also delightful that EVERYTHING on the menu was vegetarian or vegan and we didn't have to ask about any hidden fish/oyster sauce that may be in the dish. 

The next time that I am in the Seattle area, I will definitely bring anyone that is with me to this outstanding restaurant.

data.title: Love coming here for dinner
data.text: I have never been here for the buffet, which seems to have turned off some reviewers, but I have visited several times for dinner. This is a great place to eat if you love vegetables - I've enjoyed banana curry, pumpkin curry, thai brussels sprouts, unique mushroom dishes, excellent fresh rolls, mango salad, and more. It's not your typical Thai food and everything I've had has been great.

data.title: It didn't kill me
data.text:
Let's just get this out: I'm NOT a vegetarian, but I do love Thai food, and I went here as part of a group from work for the lunch buffet. 

The food:
Most of the food was on the bland side and required significant amounts of chili to make it more palatable. The ubiquitous tofu tastes as if it had been steamed on it's own and then mixed in with all of the dishes. And it did seem like ALL of the dishes had it. The Phad Thai was overly sweet and utilized too much ketchup, and was rather boring and did not have any of the traditional garnish. The green and red curry's were watery and pretty bland as well. The spring rolls and peanut sauce were good, as was the red/brown rice.

Service:
It's a buffet, and all of the offerings were routinely replenished and didn't run out of anything. They did take a while to come and remove some dirty plates, but it wasn't horrible.

I deducted a circle from poor to terrible because our work group was a total of 8 people. They couldn't accommodate our group size so we split into two groups, no big deal. The shady thing was they charged us a mandatory gratuity because we had a group larger than 6 but did not tell us. I *might* be okay with this if our tables were in close approximation with each other, but we were literally as far apart from each other as physically possible. I asked to speak with the manager but he was nowhere to be found, so we paid and went on our way. Granted, we would've tipped anyways, but it's the principle involved that irks me. Plus, when a tip is automatically included on a restaurant bill sales taxes are applied to it. 

Summary:
I suppose this would be a good place if one wanted to gorge themselves on mediocre Thai food, but there are MUCH better alternatives nearby which are also friendly to us omnivores.

data.title: Very good vegiterian Thai Food...
data.text: I visited this place with friends and family and as we have some vegiterians this was the place for them. They have a huge selection of vegiterian food and awesome taste is such a great price. If you are a meat lover this is not your place but if you are looking for hot spicy thai food.. don't miss this place. Best dish Basil Fried Rice, Red Curry, Spicy Noodles.

data.title: Great vegetarian restaurant
data.text: This is simply one of the best Thai vegetarian restaurants around.  Their lunch buffet is great and has a variety of vegetarian dishes all of which tasted good.  There is outdoor seating available at this restaurant and the ambience overall is good.  Highly recommend!!

data.title: Simply perfect
data.text: I went there with my girlfriend and another couple and when i saw the buffet i didnt hesitate for a second, the food looked fresh and delicious, and it actually was. It's all you can eat for 8.99 dollars and there is a wide variety of vegetables, noodles, rice, spring rolls, different sauces, all very tasty and light at the same time.... i could have kept eating there for the whole afternoon! the atmosphere was great and the staff very nice. I think it would be very hard to find something so good and healthy for the same price anywhere else!!

data.title: My New Favorite!
data.text: This is the best Thai food we have had yet. The lunch buffet is ever changing with several curries, noodle dishes, soup, fried rice, spring rolls, salads, and even a dessert. Everything is excellent. We have made it our new date spot each week. Absolutely fabulous food.

data.title: Very nice restaurant
data.text: Get there early, before 12 on weekdays for the buffet.  The food is fresh and hot and plenty of parking.  There is a wide variety of food, both glueten free and vegetarian.

data.title: 美味しいタイ料理
data.text: こちらはタイ料理のお店です。従業員さんはとてもフレンドリーで、お店は清潔でタイの芸術品を綺麗に飾っていました。バイキング式にしましたので、好きな料理をバランスよく頂きました。
